#Text=Use the Internet Archive 's Wayback Machine
#Text=Have you wondered what a website looked like in the past ?
#Text=Wish you could see Microsoft.com when Windows XP was released ?
#Text=Well , you can !
#Text=The Wayback Machine is an archival tool that contains a large collection of archived sites from the past .
#Text=This wikiHow teaches you how to find archived versions of websites with the Wayback Machine , as well as how to add websites to the archive for future use .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Viewing Archived Websites
#Text=Go to https://web.archive.org in your web browser .
#Text=You can use the Wayback Machine to see older versions of websites on any computer , phone , or tablet .
#Text=Enter the website you want to view .
#Text=You can type the full URL into the field labeled " Enter a URL or words related to a site 's homepage . "

column1: #Text=If you do n't know the address of the website , type its name ( or some keywords that describe it ) into the field instead .
#Text=Entering an address like will yield different results than entering .
#Text=Press or .
#Text=This displays the results of your search in the form of a bar graph and calendar .
#Text=If you searched for a name or by keyword , you 'll see a list of suggested sites to peruse .
#Text=Click or tap the URL and then continue to the next step .
#Text=Select a year on the bar graph .
#Text=By default , you 'll be taken to the current year on the bar graph that runs along the top of the page .
#Text=There are black bars that show how many times the page was archived by the Wayback Machine during that year .
#Text=Click an area above a year to see a 12-month calendar showing each date in that year .
#Text=If there are no black bars on the year you want to view , no website snapshots were taken that year .
#Text=Click a date on the calendar .
#Text=Depending on the site you search for , you 'll usually see green and/or blue circles around some of the calendar dates .
#Text=If a date is circled , it means there 's a snapshot of the site available from that date .
#Text=Clicking the date displays the archived version of the website .
#Text=If a website was archived multiple times on one day , the circle around the date will be a little larger .
#Text=Hover your mouse cursor over the date to see the list of archive times , then select a time to view that version .
#Text=If you see an error when you click a date or time , the site may be set up to ignore the Wayback Machine 's web crawler .
#Text=Errors can also mean that the website was unreachable at the time .
#Text=Depending on the way the site was archived , you may be able to click links on the page to see other archived content .
#Text=Unfortunately , clicking links on an archived site will usually produce an error .
#Text=Browse other archived versions of the site .
#Text=The bar graph from the previous page runs along the top of the archived website .
#Text=You can use it to check out the same site on other dates .
#Text=Use the blue arrows to jump to the previous or next archived snapshot , or click a different date to view it .
#Text=Archiving Websites Manually
#Text=Go to https://web.archive.org in your web browser .
#Text=You can use a computer , phone , or tablet to tell the Wayback Machine to take a snapshot of a specific website .
#Text=This feature is handy if you plan to use the site 's current form as a citation in the future .
#Text=Type the URL of the site you want to save into the " Save Page Now " field .

column1: #Text=It 's in the bottom-right portion of the page .
#Text=URL can be acquired by performing the following :
#Text=Be specific when entering an address .
#Text=The Wayback Machine only archives content on one page , not other linked pages .
#Text=For example , to archive this page , you 'd need to enter .
#Text=If you were to use , you 'd only be archiving wikiHow 's front page .
#Text=To get the full URL to the site you want to archive , visit that site in a web browser , and then copy the address from the bar along the top of the screen .
#Text=On a computer , highlight the URL and press ( Mac ) or ( PC ) to copy .
#Text=Right-click the " Save Page Now " field and select Paste to insert the copied URL .
#Text=On a phone or tablet , highlight the URL , tap and hold the highlighted area , and then tap Copy when it appears .
#Text=To paste the copied URL into the " Save Page Now " field , tap and hold the field , and then tap Paste .

column1: #Text=Click the button .
#Text=It 's the light gray button to the right of the text box .
#Text=This displays the website , along with the text " Saving page now " at the top-left corner .
#Text=That text will disappear once the site is saved .
#Text=Some websites cannot be archived by the Wayback Machine due to their configuration .
#Text=If you see an error , it 's usually because the site 's owner has chosen to ignore the Wayback Machine 's web crawler .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Some of the older archives are missing content .
#Text=In this case , try another date and see if all the content is present .
#Text=You cannot sign in to a website through the Wayback Machine .
#Text=This is likely to prevent you from adding comments to an older version , so to protect the screenshots , as editing them would be equivalent to editing history .
#Text=Quick Summary
